alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Catawba; Cleveland; Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 26 at 6:07PM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of the western Piedmont of North Carolina, including the following counties, Alexander, Catawba, Cleveland and Lincoln. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep moisture across the area and strong southeasterly low level flow may lead to additional heavy rainfall this evening. Isolated thunderstorms are also possible which could increase rainfall rates where they develop. Rainfall of 2 to 3 inches has already fallen with an additional inch expected through tonight. This could lead to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
